channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Heavyweight' podcast host Jonathan Goldstein on whether people can really change
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't ask. Heavyweight podcast host Jonathan Goldstein tackles the question of whether people can really change.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't ask. Heavyweight podcast host Jonathan Goldstein tackles the question of whether people can really change.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: After years of avoiding the ER, Noah Wyle feels 'right at home' in 'The Pitt'
item.description: After 11 seasons on ER, Wyle is producing, writing and starring in The Pitt. Now in Season 2, the series has earned praise for its depiction of emergency medicine. Originally broadcast April 21, 2025.
item.content:encoded: After 11 seasons on ER, Wyle is producing, writing and starring in The Pitt. Now in Season 2, the series has earned praise for its depiction of emergency medicine. Originally broadcast April 21, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Neil Diamond shares his guilty pleasure hits (Hint: 'Sweet Caroline' is on the list)
item.description: The new film Song Sung Blue is about a Neil Diamond tribute band. Before Diamond began recording his own hits, he worked in Tin Pan Alley writing songs for others. Originally broadcast in 2005.
item.content:encoded: The new film Song Sung Blue is about a Neil Diamond tribute band. Before Diamond began recording his own hits, he worked in Tin Pan Alley writing songs for others. Originally broadcast in 2005.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: In 'No Other Choice,' a loyal worker gets the ax — and starts chopping
item.description: In the latest movie from Park Chan-wook, the director behind The Handmaiden and Decision to Leave, a paper factory worker loses his job — and resolves to kill his competition for a new one.
item.content:encoded:
In the latest movie from Park Chan-wook, the director behind The Handmaiden and Decision to Leave, a paper factory worker loses his job — and resolves to kill his competition for a new one.

(Image credit: NEON)
item.dc:creator: Glen Weldon

item.title: Michael B. Jordan expands his cinematic universe
item.description: From child actor to "Sexiest Man Alive" leading man status, Jordan takes on Hollywood as director-producer and soon may win awards for his performance in Sinners.
item.content:encoded:
From child actor to "Sexiest Man Alive" leading man status, Jordan takes on Hollywood as director-producer and soon may win awards for his performance in Sinners.

(Image credit: Jeff Spicer)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Doctors say 'The Pitt' reflects the gritty realities of medicine today
item.description: The Pitt is back for a new run, evoking the tensions health care providers face in the U.S. today. Here's what one doctor says to watch out for this season.
item.content:encoded: The Pitt is back for a new run, evoking the tensions health care providers face in the U.S. today. Here's what one doctor says to watch out for this season.
item.dc:creator: Michal Ruprecht

item.title: 10 books we're looking forward to in early 2026
item.description: Did you resolve to read more in 2026? Whether you're on track or need a jump start, here are some books coming out in the next few months to considering adding to your list.
item.content:encoded: Did you resolve to read more in 2026? Whether you're on track or need a jump start, here are some books coming out in the next few months to considering adding to your list.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: 'Hedda' star Tessa Thompson wrestles with cynicism but chooses optimism
item.description: Thompson has the words "yes" and "no" tattooed on opposite arms. "I'm constantly wrestling with ... my cynicism and my optimism," she says. In addition to Hedda, she stars in the series His & Hers.
item.content:encoded:
Thompson has the words "yes" and "no" tattooed on opposite arms. "I'm constantly wrestling with ... my cynicism and my optimism," she says. In addition to Hedda, she stars in the series His & Hers.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: True crime, teen moms and global tragedy in cinemas this week
item.description: A 1970s hostage story, a generation-spanning epic of Palestinian tragedy, and a tale of 16th century conquest are all in theaters starting this week.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

A 1970s hostage story, a generation-spanning epic of Palestinian tragedy, and a tale of 16th century conquest are all in theaters starting this week.

(Image credit: Stefania Rosini)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Nick Reiner's attorney removes himself from case
item.description: Defense attorney Alan Jackson said that circumstances beyond his and Reiner's control made it "impossible" to continue representation.
item.content:encoded:
Defense attorney Alan Jackson said that circumstances beyond his and Reiner's control made it "impossible" to continue representation.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman
